name: Cognitive Behavioural Coaching (CBC) Model
description: Cognitive Behavioural Coaching (CBC) adapts CBT techniques into coaching practice. It helps clients identify and challenge unhelpful thoughts, reframe beliefs, and change behaviours to improve performance and wellbeing.

triggering_event.title: What event triggered your response?
triggering_event.description: Identify the specific situation or event that triggered the response

significant_event.title: What happened recently that stands out?
significant_event.description: Describe recent events that are noteworthy or impactful

automatic_thoughts.title: What automatic thoughts came up?
automatic_thoughts.description: Capture the immediate, automatic thoughts that arose

self_talk.title: What did you say to yourself?

emotions_felt.title: What emotions did you feel?
emotions_felt.description: Identify and name the emotions experienced

emotion_intensity.title: How strong were these emotions (0-10)?
emotion_intensity.description: Rate the intensity of emotions on a scale from 0 to 10

evidence_analysis.title: What evidence supports or contradicts these thoughts?
evidence_analysis.description: Examine evidence for and against the automatic thoughts

alternative_perspective.title: What alternative perspective is possible?
alternative_perspective.description: Explore different ways of viewing the situation

new_thought_belief.title: What new thought or belief could you practice?
new_thought_belief.description: Develop more balanced and helpful thoughts or beliefs

supporting_action.title: What action would support this?
supporting_action.description: Identify actions that would reinforce the new thought pattern

application_approach.title: How did you apply this new approach?
application_approach.description: Describe how the new approach was implemented

observed_outcomes.title: What outcomes did you observe?
observed_outcomes.description: Reflect on the results and outcomes of applying the new approach
